title: I am pretty sure support emails are automated too.
body:
Hey there,

Your account was given a two-week suspension and skipped the chat restrictions due to extreme toxicity. The use of homophobic slurs, racial slurs, telling others to kill themselves and hate speech is not tolerated. There is never a good reason to ever use these words. For you, we found the use of homophobic slurs.

[3:58] UnconsciousRage (Pantheon): you called me a %%% in select
[4:23] UnconsciousRage (Pantheon): %%%
[4:30] UnconsciousRage (Pantheon): you said yeah you %%%

Since the behavior went against the Summoner's Code, the decision to suspend this account for two weeks will not be changed. This is your first and final warning. Should ANY negative behavior continue, it will result in a permanent ban.

Jenny711
Player Support Specialist
"Let my blade speak the law"

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Aparently talking about how i was called a f6t is enough to go straight to a two week suspension on an account that I have had since 2011.

replies.body:
>There is never a good reason to ever use these words.

There is never a good reason to ever use these words.
have you ever met an actual toxic player?
Yes.

>I am pretty sure support emails are automated too

No, they are definitely not. I've talked to them about many many things and they have replied in detail that only actual people can do. 

They do have some general responses that may seem to be automated but they are still people.

> [{quoted}](name=Sukishoo,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=o2t69vEA,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2017-07-27T06:49:03.372+0000)
>
> No, they are definitely not. I've talked to them about many many things and they have replied in detail that only actual people can do. 
> 
> They do have some general responses that may seem to be automated but they are still people.

The first email is automated.

As said above:

>To save time support has replies that they basically copy and paste that cover the most common issues they get. They are always read by a human though. A red said that if you get an automated message from Riot it will say so in the message.

I am pretty sure they don't really read it. More of a light skim to know what template to use. I sent a decent sized ticket and all i got back was a template with the lines where i sad f6t selected.  They just wanted to get rid of me with their default response.
Well yeah, the initial one maybe but I know for a fact they will read them and respond genuinely if you continue on.

I have opposite feeling on EUNE support. Every single first post is written such way the description I wrote is not read. As I always write description, and in it I describe why the default template reply is not good for it, as I have checked the issues in template reply. 

Why this is case? Because I am IT specialist myself. I do check network first, as it may be my part, unless I noticed I am not only one getting problems. And I write that in the description, as I am professional, and  want to give people doing the support job as much information as I can, as their job is not easy. 

But after I told this out on NA forum, for some reason I have start to get only one template reply and after replying to it "someone did not read my desc at all" I get human reply apologizing it.

To save time support has replies that they basically copy and paste that cover the most common issues they get. They are always read by a human though. A red said that if you get an automated message from Riot it will say so in the message.

Idk about Eu support though.

He didn't use them though, he was commenting on why he was called it.


This is some Monty Python shit here.

This is reason why I talk constantly that context disappear when you remove chat of everyone else. And Riot knew it as they added to the rules "you should not argue against flamers" which mean "you should not defend yourself" when they start the current practice of **artificial stupidity system automation**. It is artificial stupidity system as it emulates human stupidity, not intelligence.

You dont even need context for my phrases.  I literally say "you called me a f6t in select," how could that ever be construed as being where I call somebody a f6t.  And yeah, i dont argue at flamers because its pointless. I am pretty sure I did not talk to talon that entire 15 minute game.  I was just conversing with my fellow laner about why I thought she was a duo with the MASSIVE FCKING TROLL AFK ROCKET LEAGUE PLAYING MOTHER FUCKER that was sitting in our bot brush since 1 minute in.

Riot considers everything not muting someone as arguing against them. And their automatic system does not see the reply you used. They do not know the context, as such AI would be really hard to make. Instead they use some kind of word checking, and you saying f6t several times. The problem was quite likely not that phrase, but "f6t" on single line alone. It does not check context (previous or next comment), thus it makes false assumption you called somebody else f6t. My case is proven that context matter.
exactly, never calling anybody out again
4:23's slur does seem to be directed towards other people.
look at the time compared to the other comments, the trist must have said "i called you what" or some shit. idr

Try explaining it again. That you didn't call him it, but mentioning it because he called you it...

Honestly doesn't sound good either way. Sorry.

Since when does talking about how i assumed sombody was duo with a troll because they said "do it f6t" in champ select to me when i said i would be willing to support after a guy hijacked champ select.  I gave up my role to this guy and then he does not even play.  He afks in bot brush and plays rocket league.  Yes, he told us he was playing rocket league.  You should actually have to use the word at somebody or even as you would if you were pissed to get any sort of consequence.  Would you rly be upset at me if i walked up to you and asked "why did you call me a f6t in class dude?"  It is all about context.  This context does not warrent a 2 week ban. IDGAF chat restrict me, its not like I talk unless I am being completely fcking trolled anyways.
I'm not saying you deserve the ban, lets make that clear. If you already told support, after the bot response, what transpired; maybe they will do a manual review.
Sry for the long comment, I am just still in awe of what happened.
Keep talking to support, till someone will actually read it, if it is really the only thing you were banned for, then you should be unbanned. You obviously didn't call anyone that yourself.
What is the point of repeating something offensive said to you in champ select in the game as well?  What possible good can come of that?

> What is the point of repeating something offensive said to you in champ select in the game as well?  What possible good can come of that?

To help heal. It sounds lame and I think everyone should just get over words, but in this situation.

1:Haha you are a [slur]
2: obviously offended, gives appropriate response
1:what did I say wrong?
2: you called me a [slur] and I didn't like it.

Both will be punished because the stupid brainchild of Riot Lyte doesn't take context into account.

The first 1 to 3 posts are automated, as their text indicate nobody read the message. AFter I stated this out on here, for some reason EUNE support have started to give me human written reply after 1 automated reply. Apparenlty Riot did not have any idea that European cheap labor countries has to be supervised to get job done due Soviet practices.
I did not see any such text, it just seemed like my request for review was not read and that the person had just selected the words that the system flagged.
